ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: 1. I think some of the readings should have been mandatory; the class could have integrated more discussion or group work through the articles.9a. I really really liked the opportunity to talk with professionals in the field at NYBG and through the teleconferences.10. The class was very basic. It might not be recommended for people with an already solid grounding in ecology.
Prof Montagnini is very knowledgeable and has a lot of knowledge to share. I loved that she brought in physical tools/specimens to pass around. The field trips were also really informative and fun.
Lots of hands on experience, lots of variety of information.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Sometimes the lectures tried to cover so much material that they felt rushed. Perhaps trying to decrease the number of topics in a lecture to make sure we get everything in.
making it less lecture based if possible.
The classroom is very old and dark.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Grant Was really helpful in sending out information clearly and keeping the class organized. He was approachable and did a great job providing input or asking engaging questions during lectures.
Always available and helpful.
I contacted both the professor and TA for help and both were very helpful.
Very helpful TA. Good questions, well organized.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I am interested in forestry and tropical areas of southeast Asia. This class provided an overview of forest management in this area.
I would like to transition into tropical ecology so this was a great foundation class
It is very relevant as a basic intro to fields related to my work. A necessary staple of many people's interests.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course because I am interested in forestry, ecology, and southeast Asia in particular. Prof Montagnini has a lot of experience in tropical forests and this seemed like a good overview course for a subject I don't know much about.
I took this course to gain knowledge about tropical forest ecology since I already had background about temperate forest ecology.
I thought it would be relevant to my work. It was.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, it did.
Yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, I did.
Yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Studying for midterm. Very helpful.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Do as many of the outside readings as possible. Start on your final project early.
Read the recommended readings too. Interrupt Florencia with lots of questions and comments as she is a great resource.

Other students told me the professor was not very good or attentive to students needs. I thoughtshe was very nice and the level of the class was perfect. Some people who already know much about the tropics may find it boring or superficial, but it is an intro course, and it's supposed to be general. People need to adjust their expectations.
